    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
The much-anticipated clash between Liverpool and West marked a thrilling encounter as both teams vied for dominance on a bright, sunny afternoon. As the referee's whistle blew at Anfield Stadium, Liverpool got the game underway, signaling the start of what would become a gripping 90-minute spectacle of football.

Early in the first half, the Liverpool fans were looking forward to seeing their team control the narrative of the match. However, within the first couple of minutes, an unexpected twist came as an early throw-in by West led to an attacking wave. West moved the ball swiftly down the flanks and took a shot on target, which found its mark brilliantly, giving them an unexpected lead just two minutes into the game. The visitors celebrated vigorously, their goal leaving Liverpool stunned.

Liverpool, trying to recover from the early setback, restarted with evident vigour. They tried to build their play methodically but struggled to find their feet thanks to West's resilient defense. The ball frequently went out of play, epitomizing Liverpool's frustrating attempts to maintain possession. Their first opportunity came at 6 minutes and 34 seconds when they managed a shot off target, but it provided a glimpse of hope for the fans. An ensuing clearance by West showed the solidity of their backline.

As Liverpool attempted to dominate the possession, West's defense held strong, maintaining their pressure and forcing Liverpool to play more conservatively. At the 10-minute mark, a foul by West allowed Liverpool an indirect free kick, but they failed to capitalize on the set piece. The match saw frequent interruptions as the ball often went out of play, breaking the rhythm for the home side.

In the 13th minute, West once again showcased their attacking prowess with a corner kick that forced Liverpool's defense into action. The subsequent attack resulted in another corner but was soon nullified by a foul from a West player. The pace of the game quickened, and both teams showed determination, with West leading the offensive plays. Liverpool, meanwhile, got a few good looks at the goal but were often held back by an offside or a missed shot.

The visitors posed another major threat around the 15th minute as they had an attempt that went off-target. The exasperation of Liverpool players was palpable as they struggled to make any headway through West's formidable defense. Despite having numerous throw-ins and corner opportunities, Liverpool's effort often fizzled out into missed shots or clearances by West. 

As the first half progressed, Liverpool's Murphy’s law seemed to apply – everything that could go wrong, did go wrong. West’s strategic defensive formations thwarted Liverpool’s every attempt, and in the 28th minute, West managed to break Liverpool’s defensive line once more. A resolute attack and clinical finishing saw West hit the back of the net again, doubling their lead and sending a wave of jubilation through their supporters.

Liverpool restarted the game in a desperate search for a goal to regain their footing. However, their passes seemed disjointed and their attacks lacked the precision required to break West's defensive lines. Even as the referee frequently stopped the game for fouls and free-kicks, Liverpool couldn't leverage their chances effectively. By the 37th minute, West had earned their first yellow card, further intensifying the rugged nature of the match.

Despite having shots on target, Liverpool's attempts at goal were either saved or went out of play. The referee's half-time whistle eventually came to the rescue of Liverpool, giving them a much-needed breather and an opportunity to regroup. The score stood at 2-0 in favour of West at the end of the first half. 

As the second half commenced, Liverpool made an immediate substitution, aimed at bringing fresh legs and renewed energy onto the pitch. The team's desperation was evident in their attempt to turn the tide. However, the dominant narrative of the game didn't change in their favor. An early clearance by West set the tone for the second half and soon became apparent that Liverpool would face even more adversity. 

Within minutes, the match witnessed its first notable controversy. A strong challenge by a Liverpool player resulted in a yellow card, quickly followed by a red for subsequent fouling. This significant setback reduced Liverpool to 10 men, making their uphill task even more formidable. The resultant indirect free-kick saw West positioning themselves threateningly. 

The game was marked by consistent attempts from Liverpool to make a dent in West's defense. They kept pressing forward, generating shots on target and forcing West's goalkeeper into action. In the 15th minute, Liverpool made another substitution, seeking to inject a spark that could possibly change the game’s complexion. 

Yet, West remained unyielding. Their own offensive forays weren’t without success as well. A foul on Liverpool’s part saw them earning another yellow card and West capitalizing by peppering the Liverpool goal with shots. Even with a numerical advantage, West continued to create pressure, leading to yet another goal-scoring opportunity in the 46th minute, this time leading to their third goal.

Liverpool’s effort to mount a comeback proved futile. They continued to battle, with further substitutions aimed to alter their fortunes, but West’s defense kept standing tall. Despite numerous attempts to advance through the wings and create through the middle, Liverpool couldn't make significant inroads. The game saw a succession of throw-ins, free kicks, and Liverpool’s missed opportunities.

West’s time management strategies came into play as frequent clearances and slow build-ups consumed the clock. Liverpool’s desperation led to more fouls, resulting in additional yellow cards and stopping the game flow. As the game headed into the final moments, Liverpool's frustration culminated in more fouls leading to yet another yellow card.

With the match ticking toward the end, the final minutes were marred by Liverpool’s inability to break through, and West taking every opportunity to hold their ground defensively, ensuring their lead remained unassailable. There were glimpses of goal-scoring chances by Liverpool, which continued to be saved or miss the target, highlighting a day of missed opportunities for the home side.

Ultimately, the final whistle blew, confirming West’s emphatic 3-0 victory over Liverpool. Those early goals, combined with a robust defensive display and disciplined tactical execution, paved the way for West's triumphant outing at Anfield. Despite Liverpool’s relentless spirit and attempts, they couldn't overturn the deficit created early on in the game. West's excellent finishing and stout defending ensured that they walked away with all three points, much to the dismay of the passionate Liverpool supporters.

The game served as a reminder of football's unpredictability and the importance of converting chances when they present themselves. West's brilliant performance away from home today will be remembered as a fortress of solid defense and clinical attacking prowess, whereas Liverpool will reflect on missed opportunities and lapses of concentration that led to this unexpected defeat.
